summary: This bill, "Edward J. Dwight, Jr., Congressional Gold Medal Act of 2025," proposes awarding a Congressional Gold Medal to Edward J. Dwight, Jr., the first African-American astronaut candidate.  The bill outlines Dwight's life, highlighting his accomplishments in both space endeavors and artistic pursuits. It details his training, the challenges he faced due to racial prejudice, and his subsequent career as an artist. The bill mandates the Speaker of the House and the President pro tempore of the Senate to arrange for the medal presentation, and authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to strike and sell duplicate bronze medals.
